Posts.Content: hope it went ok for you and your not feeling too awful. mine went well and apart from feeling a bit hung over i am ok. 1 down 5 to go, there will be light at the end of the tunnel. good luck
Posts.Title: 1st chemo

Posts.Content: Hi everyone had my first chemo today, as some of you said it was'nt as bad as the anticipation.. laying on the sofa watching corrie, just feel a bit weird. amazed at the amount of people that were there having treament. young and old. still waiting for bone scan results. has any one else had their first one recently? hope you are all feeling good, x
Posts.Title: 1st chemo

Posts.Content: Must add to this even though its not about the hair, Felt a bit down today, day 4 after chemo, was in the house listening to my son playing in the garden, i could hear him shouting across the gardens to the kids who live 3 doors down...''you cant come and play cause my mummys only got one boobie'' But she getting a new one! He made my day! Thank you my darling for making Mummy laugh.
Posts.Title: Telling Young Children About Hair Loss

Posts.Content: Hi have had one of the above, and am on day 4, been feeling a bit out of sorts, achey headache, bit off colour. but managed tescos with my 4 year old today. been taking pain killers but nothing too strong. Drinking loads of water to counter it. bit of a funny taste in my mouth but again not too bad. Hope this is as bad as it gets. Hope this is some use to you. Vicki
Posts.Title: Anyone experience of TC chemo (Taxotere and Cyclophosphamide)????...

Posts.Content: Hi All, injections are for boosting white blood cells to ward off neutrapena(spelling?).Have to do it every day for 7 days after chemo.Managed to do todays myself. A tiny bit achey and feeling the familiar prickly in my head...so wish i didnt have to loose my hair again! oh and am walking around with a very red face...wondering if that the steroid effect. Loved the wig story, hay ho hope you've all had a good day. Vicki
Posts.Title: Docetaxal for me better than FEC

Posts.Content: Hi had my first tax yesterday, Unpleasent taste in my mouth, no pain yet. am having injections every day for 7 days, Any one else having them.Vicki
Posts.Title: Docetaxal for me better than FEC

Posts.Content: Hi Sally. hope i am not being too intrusive, went through exactly what you are going through. some hair does come out when using the cap cause it does'nt reach every follicle. so you will loose some, have you got thick hair, the cap also works better on shorter hair so maybe cut it shorter and carry on with the cap. its so consuming, but you will know what to do as you go along, ive still got wieght on me from the baby, so i look like uncle fester, ha,ha not! hope tomorrow goes well for you, 2 down!
Posts.Title: Hair loss/cold cap and FEC-T

Posts.Content: Hi I too used the cap for my first cycle, the hair stayed put for nearly 3 weeks, at the 2nd cycle the nurses activly discouraged me from doing it,(the cap), saying it didnt really work. i didnt continue! I had already cut my hair shorter, and by cycle 3 hair was falling out, but as i had such thick hair it still covered my whole head. i just got fed up worrying about it and borrowed some clippers and shaved it off myself, it looked ok. a week before cycle 5 (2 weeks ago)i shaved it again as it had really started to thin and did not look ok. I have found this bit quite hard, and cannot wait for it to grow back It is so difficult contemplating losing your hair I am sure if you carry on using the cap you wont loose all of it. but expect some loss then maybe anything else is a bonus. dont be too hasty with the clippers. hope your treatment goes ok! x
Posts.Title: Hair loss/cold cap and FEC-T

Posts.Content: Tessa and Sally, am a bit ahead of you in the hair loss department, just had chemo number 5, and have only LOST my hair compleatly in the last couple of weeks. hate it. there is nothing anyone can say that will make you feel better, have a bloody good cry, for your hair and the poo you have to deal with. I cried long and hard, every day, for my hair, for my baby for myself, then one day i woke up and felt better. each day brings a bit more hope, and you gain a little bit more strength, and it gets easier. keep strong x
Posts.Title: Hair loss/cold cap and FEC-T

Posts.Content: i had started chemo then around the 4th cycle I started herceptin along side it. am on number 12 herceptin now. having the 2 treatments along side each other was fine. i am now recieving my herceptin at home. which is great. all the best to you and your Mum. Â
Posts.Title: herceptin and cemo together

Posts.Content: Hi I have just used a site called allclear got a decent quote. easy to use.have a great holiday.
Posts.Title: Holiday insurance

Posts.Content: Good luck tomorrow mandy, got my first one on monday. let us know how you get on. x
Posts.Title: First Chemo very nervous

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, hope things are going well for you all! am having chemo to shrink lump and have had 3, last one was wednesday. i saw the onc before hand who examined me and said that the lump had ''no clinical change'' but they would know more when i have a scan on 3rd july. i am now worried, does anyone know any thing about using chemo to shrink lumps? should it have started to shrink by now? just feel like it is not working? lump and armpit hurt is that normal? i dont feel too ill with the chemo, just very tired, and very down in the dumps. should i feel worse, cant help but think if i felt worse it would be working. god what a nuerotic iam.
Posts.Title: lump not shrinking!
